ITEM.name: Creating Interfaces
ITEM.text: describes the way to expose your component type and behavior

ITEM.name: Creating Interfaces for Automation
ITEM.text: explains how to make your interfaces available from scripting languages

ITEM.name: Implementing Interfaces for Automation
ITEM.text: explains how to make your components available from scripting languages

ITEM.name: The IDL Compiler
ITEM.text: describes the CAA IDL and how to convert your interfaces to C++ abstract classes

ITEM.name: Creating Interfaces
ITEM.text: is an example of declaring a component expected type and behavior.

ITEM.name: Creating Components
ITEM.text: describes how you can enable your clients to create your usable and scalable components

ITEM.name: Using Components
ITEM.text: shows you how to create component instances, ask for interface pointers, call interface methods, and manage component lifecycle

ITEM.name: Creating Components
ITEM.text: is an example of making objects that implement interfaces

ITEM.name: Implementing an Interface Using the BOA
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a data extension class that derives from the interface

ITEM.name: Creating and Instantiating a Component
ITEM.text: is an example of implementing CATICreateInstance and of using CATInstantiateComponent

ITEM.name: Instantiating a Component using its CLSID
ITEM.text: is an example of implementing IClassFactory and using CATCreateInstance

ITEM.name: Creating a Component Factory
ITEM.text: is an example of enabling component instantiation without be tied to the component implementation

ITEM.name: Using Components
ITEM.text: is an example of creating components, asking for interface pointers, and managing component life cycle.

ITEM.name: Using Components in Batch
ITEM.text: is another example of creating components, asking for interface pointers, and managing component life cycle.

ITEM.name: Object Modeler Inheritances
ITEM.text: explains what are OM interface and component inheritances

ITEM.name: Using OM-derivation
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a component that OM-derives from an existing one.

ITEM.name: Interface Quick Reference
ITEM.text: shows a detailed roadmap for creating interfaces

ITEM.name: About Globally Unique IDentifiers
ITEM.text: shows you how to name your interface with a label unique the world over for some centuries

ITEM.name: What Is HRESULT?
ITEM.text: describes a standard return value for all your interface methods

ITEM.name: About __stdcall
ITEM.text: to make your interface methods comply with Automation

ITEM.name: The Execution Context
ITEM.text: explains the way to control where your request can be executed.
